alert.note: Alert for Clarendon; Southeastern Orangeburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 30 at 11:48AM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Clarendon and southeastern Orangeburg Counties through 1215 PM EST... At 1146 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Holly Hill, or 12 miles northeast of Indian Field, moving east at 35 mph. ...Boaters on Lake Marion Should Seek Safe Harbor... HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Holly Hill, Santee, Eutawville, Vance, Eautaw Springs, Indian Bluff Recreation Park, Rocks Pond Campground and Marina, Blounts Landing and Mill Creek Marina and Campground. This includes the following highways... Interstate 26 between mile markers 168 and 169. Interstate 95 between mile markers 85 and 99. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
